meta.name: description
meta.content: District 214 State and AP Testing updates due to coronavirus, Covid-19.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: AP testing, AP online exam, SAT, District 214, Buffalo Grove, Elk Grove, John Hersey High school, Prospect High School, Rolling Meadows High School, Wheeling High School
meta.title: State and AP Testing Covid-19 Updates | d214

div.h1: State and AP Testing Covid-19 Update

div.span: State and AP Testing Covid-19 Update

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: The Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) submitted a statewide waiver to the U.S. Department of Education to waive all federally required assessments for this school year. The federally waived assessments include the PSAT 8/9, PSAT 10, SAT, DLM and Illinois Science Assessment.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The Illinois State Board of Education is working with the College Board on developing options to allow current 11th grade students to take the SAT in the fall. More information will be posted here as we learn more from ISBE.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; white-space: pre-wrap;
background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.span: District 214 staff and students have dedicated a great deal of time and energy to their Advanced Placement (AP) courses. Due to school closures, students will now be able to take the AP exam(s) at home. College Board is developing secure online exams for each course based on topics and skills most AP teachers covered in class by early March. Below are some important College Board updates as we prepare for these online AP exams:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: For the 2019-20 exam administration only, students can take a 45-minute online exam at home.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: The exams will be available between May 11 - May 22. Students can view the date for their exam(s) by looking at the AP Exam schedule on College Board's website. We encourage all students to take the test on the initial test dates, however there are

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: makeup dates available if students have conflicts.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Exams start at 11am, 1pm, or 3pm central time depending on the test.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Students will be able to take these exams on computers, iPads, or mobile devices. The Exam will also allow students to take a photo of handwritten work, if that is preferred over typing.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: All District 214 students have iPads from their school that can be used for taking the AP Exam. Students will receive a unique link by email from College Board in order to take the exam based on the email set up in their My AP Account.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: The exams will be open note and open book which may be new for students. College Board has provided tips for success on open note and open book exams. College Board has also clearly stated the rules for the exams and have added security to help identify students who aren't following the rules.

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
span.a: ​District 214 AP Online Exam Frequently Asked Questions

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: More specific information for each AP subject can be found on College Board's website,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

a.span: AP Updates for Schools Affected by Coronavirus

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: . College Board has been updating this website weekly.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-family: Arial; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
span.span: College Board Webinar for Parents and Students

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: : "Helping Your Students Prepare for the AP Exam" was presented on Thursday, April 16 from 6pm-7pm CST. If you missed the presentation, it can still be viewed on demand here.
